encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

bibl.title: The Apa Apollos Monastery of Pharoou (Aphrodito) and its Papyrus Archive.
bibl.note: Publishes 28 Coptic and Greek papyri from the Egyptian Museum, reproduced by the Antiquities Service in a booklet without any texts: Hishmat MESSIHA, Fragments of Coptic and Greek Papyri from Kom Ichkaw (Le Caire, 1983). - 6 documents are written in Greek: 2. Inv. SR 3733 (36) (Cairo Plate 11). Contract. 9 November A.D. 547; - 17. Inv. SR 3733 (23a) (Cairo Plate 43). Beginning of Contract. 28.ix.578; - 18. Inv. SR 3733 (29a) (Cairo Plate 37). Beginning of Contract. Between August and November A.D. 602; - 19. Inv. 3733 (29b) (Cairo Plate 37). Fragment of Contract; - 24. Inv. 3733 (44) (Cairo Plate 40). Lease of Sown Land. A.D. 528, 543, 558 or 573; - 28. Inv. 3733 (41) (Cairo Plates 32 and 33). Opisthograph draft of a letter from Dioscorus to, presumably, the monastery's governing board. [The fragment has been re-united with its left half, as P. Cair. Inv. SR 3733 (B) + 3805 (12) + 3733 (41), by: Alia HANAFI, A Letter from the Archive of Dioscorus, Proceedings of the XVIII International Congress of Papyrology. II (Athens, 1988) pp. 91-106, 2 pll.]
